newsitem.title: USA: MECKLENBURG CTY, N.C., OKAYS $500 MLN BOND VOTE.
newsitem.headline: MECKLENBURG CTY, N.C., OKAYS $500 MLN BOND VOTE.

text.p: North Carolina's Mecklenburg County Commission has given final approval to a $500 million general obligation bond referendum.
The bond package approved Tuesday night is the county's largest and will go before voters on Nov. 4.

It includes $415 million of GO bonds to finance construction of 20 new public schools and renovations at 40 existing schools, plus $62 million of GO bonds for jail expansion and $23 million of GOs for community colleges.
Debt service on the bonds would add about $80 to the porperty tax bill for a $150,000 home by 2001.
